problem_text:
14.8. Let G denote the group of germs at +∞ of orientation-preserving homeomorphisms of the real line R. Let α ∈ G be the germ of x ↦ x + 1. What are the germs β ∈ G for which the subgroup ⟨α, β⟩ of G generated by α and β is free of rank 2?
If β is the germ of x ↦ xk for an odd integer k ⩾ 3, it is known that ⟨α, β⟩ is free of rank 2. The proofs of this rely on Galois theory (for k an odd prime: S. White, J. Algebra, 118 (1988), 408–422; for any odd k ⩾ 3: S. A. Adeleke, A. M. W. Glass, L. Morley, J. London Math. Soc., 43 (1991), 255–268, and for any odd k ≠ ±1 and any even k > 0 in several papers by S. D. Cohen and A. M. W. Glass).
P. de la Harpe
